message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.IT, cs.CG 

The paper deals with the problem of energy compaction of dense 4D light fields by designing geometry-aware local graph-based transforms. This involves the use of computer vision techniques (cs.CV) to process the light fields, as well as graph theory (cs.GR) to construct the local graphs. The paper also discusses a coding scheme to assess the rate-distortion performances of the proposed transforms, which involves multimedia (cs.MM) and information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper proposes a novel transform optimization method that aims at preserving angular correlation even when the shapes of the super-pixels are not isometric, which involves computational geometry (cs.CG).
